intro: Chloracantha, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
